interface.name: com.citrix.xenclient.xenmgr
interface.tp:docstring: Main xenmgr interface, used for VM creation and enumeration.

method.name: list_vms
method.tp:docstring: List each VM present. Returns a list of dicts with few critical properties filled for each VM, including VM state, domain ID (if running), uuid etc.

method.name: list_domids
method.tp:docstring: List current domain IDs.

method.name: list_child_service_vm_templates
method.tp:docstring: List the templates for creating child service VMs.

method.name: list_templates
method.tp:docstring: List the templates for creating new VMa.

method.name: list_ui_templates
method.tp:docstring: List the UI-visible VM creation templates.

method.name: list_extension_packs
method.tp:docstring: List installed extension packs. Returns array of dictionaries, where each dict contains following keys: vendor, name, description, version, image.

method.name: find_vm_by_uuid
method.tp:docstring: Returns the object path to the VM with the given UUID, or raises an error.

method.name: find_vm_by_domid

method.name: create_vm

method.name: create_vm_with_template
method.tp:docstring: Create a new VM based on the given template.

method.name: create_vm_with_template_and_uuid
method.tp:docstring: Create a new VM based on the given template and UUID.

method.name: create_vm_with_template_and_json
method.tp:docstring: Create a new VM based on given template file and JSON blob. Template or json can be left empty

method.name: create_vm_with_ui
method.tp:docstring: Create a new VM based on the given template, with ui properties initially set.

method.name: create_vhd
method.tp:docstring: Create a new VHD.

signal.name: vm_state_changed

signal.name: vm_name_changed
signal.tp:docstring: Notify that VM name has changed.

signal.name: config_changed
signal.tp:docstring: Notify xenmgr that host level configuration has changed.

signal.name: language_changed
signal.tp:docstring: Notify that the language settings have changed.

signal.name: vm_created
signal.tp:docstring: Notify that a VM was created.

signal.name: vm_deleted

interface.name: com.citrix.xenclient.xenmgr.config
interface.tp:docstring: xenmgr configuration information, mostly living in the /xenmgr db tree.

property.name: platform-crypto-key-dirs
property.tp:docstring: Comma separated list of disk encryption keys directories.

property.name: guest-only-networking
property.tp:docstring: If true, networking features in dom0/networking VM are disabled.

property.name: vm-creation-allowed
property.tp:docstring: Allow creation of VMs on this host.

property.name: vm-deletion-allowed
property.tp:docstring: Allow deletion of VM on this host.

property.name: ota-upgrades-allowed
property.tp:docstring: Allow over the air upgrades on this host.

property.name: connect-remote-desktop-allowed
property.tp:docstring: Allow using remote desktop (via icavm).

property.name: measure-fail-action
property.tp:docstring: Action to perform when computing service VM checksum fails: sleep,hibernate,shutdown,reboot,nothing.

property.name: argo-firewall
property.tp:docstring: If true, argo firewall is enabled, rejecting all incoming traffic by default.

property.name: secondary-gpu-pt
property.tp:docstring: True if passthrough of secondary GPUs supported.

property.name: configurable-save-changes-across-reboots
property.tp:docstring: True if user can opt to not save VHD changes across VM reboot.

property.name: enable-ssh
property.tp:docstring: Enable external SSH access to dom0.

property.name: enable-argo-ssh
property.tp:docstring: Enable internal SSH access to dom0.

property.name: enable-dom0-networking
property.tp:docstring: Have dom0 connect to external network using DHCP.

property.name: dom0-mem-target-mib
property.tp:docstring: Dom0 balloon memory target, in mebibytes. If 0, don't balloon dom0.

property.name: autolock-cd-drives
property.tp:docstring: Automatically lock/unlock cd drives to vms on media insert/eject events

property.name: modify-usb-settings
property.tp:docstring: If false, user will be unable to change vUSB device assignment.

property.name: switcher-enabled
property.tp:docstring: True if seamless mouse switching is enabled.

property.name: switcher-self-switch-enabled
property.tp:docstring: If false, switching to the actual current slot will do nothing.

property.name: switcher-keyboard-follows-mouse
property.tp:docstring: If false, when mouse-switching, the keyboard stays in it's slot until a mouse click.

property.name: switcher-resistance
property.tp:docstring: Determines how hard the edges are for mouse-switching.

property.name: switcher-status-report-enabled
property.tp:docstring: If false, CTRL+ALT+R to generate a status report in the UI will be disabled.

property.name: idle-time-threshold
property.tp:docstring: Determines the amount of time the host can be idle after which it goes to sleep.

property.name: language
property.tp:docstring: Current language.

property.name: supported-languages
property.tp:docstring: List of supported languages.

property.name: drm-graphics
property.tp:docstring: Enable DRM graphics plugin on older hardware (pre-haswell)

interface.name: com.citrix.xenclient.xenmgr.guestreq
interface.tp:docstring: Some well defined requests coming from guests.

method.name: request_attention
method.tp:docstring: Guest requests user attention. Executing this method from any guest VM (User VM or Service VM) will cause a dialog box in both the UIVM and Windows guests to alert the user that the VM which sent it requires attention. This is useful for the case where a service VM needs credentials from the user or has an issue which requires user intervention to resolve. Note that the dialog box means a VM wants you to switch to the VM; but it does NOT mean that we recommend that you take any action, including but not limited to giving your attention to any VM that is requesting said attention. A malicious VM can repeatedly call this function and cause this dialog box to appear repeatedly; there is no time delay that limits how often any VM can request attention.

signal.name: requested_attention
signal.tp:docstring: Notify that VM has requested attention.
